title: Barcelona under pressure to sell Philippe Coutinho to balance books in 2020
text:

Barcelona will be desperate for Philippe Coutinho to succeed at Bayern Munich as the Brazilian is key to their financial stability in 2020.

That's according to sources close to ESPN FC , who claim that Barca must secure around £111.2million (€124million) in player sales before the end of this season in order to make their financial model work, having recently switched to making the sales of players a priority in the running of the club.

Failure to do so could lead to pressure on the club's board, and possibly even calls for their removal.

The new model was established in the wake of Neymar's world record £199million move to Paris Saint-Germain in 2017, with the club's finances shifting dramatically in the wake of such a windfall.

(Image: Bongarts/Getty Images)

They have since budgeted for big departures, making it imperative that they eventually receive a large fee for the services of Coutinho, who joined Bayern Munich on loan with an option to buy this summer .

The decision to buy rests solely with Bayern, who have an option to sign the Brazilian for £107.6million (€120million) at the end of the loan deal, but must let Barca know by June 30 if they intend to do it.

Coutinho has so far played eight games for the Bavarian club, scoring goals in the Bundesliga wins over Cologne and Paderborn.

The sale of the former Liverpool man would ensure that Barca receive almost all of their target figure, while Ivan Rakitic is another player who looks likely to depart this year.

(Image: TONI ALBIR/EPA-EFE/REX)

Along with Coutinho, the Croatian snubbed a move to Paris Saint-Germain in the summer as part of the deal to bring Neymar back to Barca, but he is attracting interest from clubs in Serie A having fallen down the midfield pecking order.

The former Sevilla man could seek an exit in the January transfer window.
description: The Brazilian has joined Bayern Munich on loan, although the Germans don't have to make the move permanent if they don't wish to
